revisions.rev:
'''Rugby union trophies and awards''' have been given out to teams and participants from the very earliest days of the sport's history. In common with many other sports [[rugby union]] has an array of competitions, both domestic international, covering the spectrum of competition structures from season long leagues, to one-off matches. The list below is divided into sections such that trophies and awards competed for by national sides are grouped together, as are those competed for by club and provincial sides. In both cases, the type of award can differ. The award might be a perpetual trophy, which is one competed for in perpetuity by two sides such that on each occasion they meet, which may or may not be on a regular basis, that honour is contested. The award may be one that is given to the winner of a tournament, or as a subset of this, as an award for a particular honour attained in that tournament. Additionally, the sport of rugby union bestows certain honours on individual players, and these too have their own dedicated section below. ==International Trophies== {| class="sortable wikitable" border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" style="margin:auto;" |+'''Rugby union international trophies''' ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Name of trophy ! style="background:#ffdead;"|First Contested ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Last Contested ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Type ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Image ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Participants and Record ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Current holders ! style="background:#ffdead;"|Notes |- |[[Bledisloe Cup]]||1931||2011||Perpetual Trophy|| [[File:1949 Wallabies with BledisloeCup image.jpg|centre|thumb|100px |[[Colin Windon]] (left) & [[Trevor Allan]] (right) with victorious 1949 Bledisloe Cup Wallabies]] ||{{ru|NZL}}-39

Named after another All Black great, [[Brian Lochore]]. |- | [[Hanan Shield]] || || |||||||||| |- | [[Bouclier de Brennus]] || 1892 || 2011 || Domestic ||[[File:Bouclier de Brennus.jpg|centre|100px]] || {{flagicon|France}} [[Top 14|French League]]
For winners see [[Top 14#Total wins]] || [[Stade Toulousain|Toulouse]] ||Trophy awarded to the winners of the French [[rugby union]] [[Top 14|domestic league]]. Named after Charles Brennus, cofounder of France's original rugby governing body, [[Union des SociÃ©tÃ©s FranÃ§aises de Sports AthlÃ©tiques|USFSA]], who created the shield based on a design by the other cofounder, [[Pierre de Coubertin]]. The original trophy is no longer presented. Due to its increasingly battered condition, it was decided in 2003 to restore the trophy and place it on permanent static display. In each season since 2003, with the exception of 2004 when the original was used one final time, a replica of the original shield has been presented. |- | [[European Challenge Cup]] || 1996 || 2011 || Tournament || || Clubs from {{flagicon|ENG}} [[English Premiership (rugby union)|England]], {{flagicon|FRA}} [[Top 14|France]], and {{flagicon|ITA}} [[Super 10 (Italian premiership)|Italy]] always compete, as well as [[Bucharest Oaks|a specially created team]] from {{ROU}}. Clubs from {{flagicon|IRE|rugby union}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Ireland]] and {{flagicon|WAL}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Wales]] usually compete as well. Clubs from {{flagicon|SCO}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Scotland]] do not start in the competition, but may parachute in from the Heineken Cup. Also, one club from either {{flagicon|ESP}} [[DivisiÃ³n de Honor de Rugby|Spain]] or {{flagicon|PRT}} [[Campeonato Nacional Honra/Super Bock|Portugal]] also qualifies.
For winners, see [[European Challenge Cup#Finals|European Challenge Cup finals]]. || {{flagicon|ENG}} [[Harlequin F.C.|Harlequins]] || Also known for sponsorship reasons as the [[Amlin]] Challenge Cup. |- | [[Heineken Cup]] || 1996 || 2011 || Tournament || || Clubs from {{flagicon|ENG}} [[English Premiership (rugby union)|England]], {{flagicon|FRA}} [[Top 14|France]], {{flagicon|IRE|rugby union}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Ireland]], {{flagicon|ITA}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Italy]], {{flagicon|SCO}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Scotland]] and {{flagicon|WAL}} [[Celtic League (rugby union)|Wales]].
For winners see [[Heineken Cup#Records and statistics|Heineken Cup records and statistics]]. || {{flagicon|IRE|rugby union}} [[Leinster Rugby|Leinster]] || Named after the competition's sponsor, [[Heineken International|Heineken]]. |- | [[Pacific Rugby Cup]] ||2006 ||2009 || Tournament||||{{Flagicon|Fiji}} [[Fiji Warriors]]
